revised_title: Reduction of Tracheal Mite Parasitism in Honey Bees through Swarming
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand the relationship between tracheal mite parasitism and honey bee colony dynamics. They found that swarming, a natural behavior in honey bees, can reduce mite density within a colony. This discovery has implications for modern hive management techniques and may help explain the sudden appearance of tracheal mites in various regions.
